column1: Summary
The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst will support the Data and analytics team's vision by developing/maintaining reports
column3: and data-related processes. The role also ensures that business intelligence enhances business decision-making capabilities.

column1: The resource will also be involved in all aspects of business intelligence development
The successful candidate will have a demonstrated track record of leveraging analytics and business intelligence
column2: drive for value in a collaborative approach
column3: and be willing to share best practices and mentor in a growing team.

column1: Duties And Responsibilities

To perform this job successfully an individual must be able to perform the following essential duties satisfactorily. Other duties may be assigned to address business needs and changing business practices.
Empower business units to access and consume Greenbrier data.
Work closely with the Data & Analytics management in designing and building Greenbrier’s Business Intelligence platform.
Function as liaison between IT and users
column2: utilizing both business and technical knowledge.

column1: Collaborate with business units to generate relevant KPIs
Allow business units to self-serve their data needs from trusted data sources.
Respond to internal and external requests in a timely and professional manner.
Optimize solutions for performance and security.
Qualifications
The following generally describes requirements to successfully perform the assigned duties.
Minimum Qualifications
Undergraduate degree from an accredited four-year program
column2: preferably in computer science or a related area of study or equivalent experience.

column1: 5+ years of enterprise-level report writing.
5+ years of Microsoft Power BI experience. Some experience with SSAS Tabular or Power Pivot development can count towards this requirement.
2+ years of experience in SSRS and/or Report Builder applications.
1+ years of self-service BI experience.
Ability to quickly understand complex data sets.
Data manipulation and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail and concern for order and quality.
Good research skills
column2: including talking to end users and product owners.

column1: Advanced DAX/M experience.
Advanced Tabular modeling concepts.
Solid relational and non-relational database experience.
Work Environment And Physical Requirements
Work Environment

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
This position is in an office setting.

column1: Job Description:

At the Mallett Agency we’re committed to hiring qualified candidates for our team. We seek a recruitment assistant to support the hiring team in recruiting and onboarding activities. Beyond coordinating schedules and carrying out clerical duties like candidate database maintenance
column2: the recruitment assistant will help screen candidates and assist interviewees. So
column3: the recruitment assistant should be an excellent communicator who works well with a team. They should possess a keen
column4: analytical mind for evaluating candidates based on qualifications and skills to determine if they’re a good company fit.

column1: Objectives of this role
Support the hiring team with recruiting
Facilitate a smooth hiring process for both the hiring team and job applicants
Maintain the hiring department’s high degree of organization and efficiency by exhibiting meticulous attention to detail
Draft communications materials
Collaborate with the hiring team to carry out streamlined onboarding processes
Research and recruit candidates to widen the qualified applicant pool
Responsibilities
Perform clerical duties like emailing
Review applications and screen candidates
Schedule interviews and communicate with candidates
Hold group interviews at least 3 times per week
Maintain an accurate
Assist candidates during the interview process
column2: answering questions and providing them with key materials

column1: Skills And Qualifications
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a group
Excellent problem-solving capabilities
Perceptive listening skills
Comprehensive knowledge of the hiring process
Daily log of candidates interviewed and what progress/position they are in interview process
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working as a recruiter or in a related role
Great attention to detail
Strong time management and organizational skills
Outstanding clerical skills
High degree of discretion and ability to maintain confidentiality
Resilience in the face of unexpected challenges and setbacks
Must have own telephone and computer/laptop. (not provided)
By applying you agree to be contacted by telephone
column2: email and text in regards to this position ONLY.

You will be required to obtain and maintain an interim and/or final security clearance prior to entrance on duty. Failure to obtain and maintain the required level of clearance may result in the withdrawal of a job offer or removal.

This position is covered under the Defense Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act (DAWIA). Certification in the Acquisition Functional Area and category assigned to the position is required within established category timeframes.

This position may require travel from normal duty station to CONUS and OCONUS and may include remote or isolated sites. You must be able to travel on military and commercial aircraft for extended periods of time.
Qualifications

Your resume must also demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to the DP-03 pay band or GS-9/11 grade level in the Federal service or equivalent experience in the private or public sector. column1: Description

The EFT Operations Fraud Specialist is responsible for processing debit card disputed items and investigating claims in a fast paced work environment. The EFT Operations Fraud Specialist will serve as the primary contact for all debit card related inquiries and research for both internal and external customers. The incumbent will possess knowledge of debit card dispute processing rules
Essential Functions
Processes debit card disputes
column2: ensuring appropriate and complete documentation is obtained from the customer
column3: and all appropriate documentation is maintained in the dispute files.

column1: Completes dispute log to provide status of disputes at any time.
Processes disputed items in Data Navigator
column2: and performs follow ups on outstanding items.

column1: Sends required correspondence to customer and branch personnel regarding the status of their disputed items.
Understands and maintains compliance with Regulation E and MasterCard Zero Liability Rules while adhering to bank policies and procedures.
Demonstrates regulatory and technical knowledge to provide guidance and support to branch staff and customers on dispute items.
Ensures debit card orders are completed accurately and in appropriate time frames.
Review and Process compromised card reissuances and ensures card closure upon new card activation to reduce fraud risk to the institution.
Ensures daily-automated tasks are complete through review of files and reports
May be crossed trained in other areas of Operations/EFT related functions.
Manages strict deadlines and performs time sensitive duties accurately and efficiently.
Maintains a working knowledge of all functions within the department to sustain integrity of the department’s guidelines.
This position may require extended weekday hours.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Key Qualifications
Education
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance preferred
Experience
3+ years of banking experience preferably in EFT Operations.
1-2 years working with Debit Card dispute processing.
Previous related experience in Mobile Deposits
Previous experience researching trending fraud issues.
Technical Skills including Microsoft Office.
Experience with core banking solution
Knowledge of EFT and Fraud processes and regulations.
Proven experience building solid working relationships with teammates
Solid business and communication skills with the ability to prioritize workload and to communicate clearly and concisely.
The position requires a person with meticulous attention to detail
column3: ability to multitask and meet multiple deadlines

column2: code of ethics and follows all policies and procedures relative to Consumer Compliance laws and regulations and best practice recommendations.

column1: Job Description
The Sales Operations Data Analyst will be responsible for developing reports
column2: visualizations and dashboards to provide visibility into sales forecast
column4: and identify opportunities for process improvements. The successful candidate will have the ability to work independently and within a team environment.

column1: Review and optimize the use of Salesforce to ensure data quality and accessibility for the sales team.

Competitive analysis for wins and losses including pricing

column1: Are you filled with endless enthusiasm and dedication towards engineering data to tackle ever-changing challenges that will shape the future of retail? Walmart's extensive operations come with vast and complex sets of data
column2: presenting unparalleled opportunities for analysis and insights.

column1: About The Data And Customer Analytics (DCA) Organization
Our organization focuses on managing and delivering world-class data assets
column2: including creating and maintaining data standards
column5: and developing pipelines and self-service tools. We empower our business to leverage data to fuel growth
column6: driving revenue in our core and building new business model opportunities.

column1: About Team
Everyone has data
column2: but the sheer volume of data at Walmart can be limitless. In the Data Engineering team
column3: we help Walmart manage this data by building pipelines and data lakes to prepare big data for analysis and unlocking actionable insights in real-time. We also use cross-departmental data and machine learning to build a holistic view of true profitability
column4: saving millions of dollars across item categories and geographies while assisting our leadership in making better decisions faster.

column1: What You'll Do
Your primary responsibility will be to oversee and manage data pipeline processes that utilize cutting-edge data engineering techniques to generate critical datasets for Walmart.
You will be responsible for promptly addressing any issues or failures in data streaming and batch applications
Your role will involve acting as a gatekeeper to maintain the integrity and reliability of production data systems.
You will develop automation tools to monitor and alert platform components and data pipelines.
You will contribute to the ongoing design
column3: and maintenance of systems and tools within our data platform.

column1: You will assess and provide recommendations for optimizing resource usage in data pipelines built on a big data stack.
You will collaborate closely with engineering teams to contribute to their roadmap and assist in capacity planning for our big data stack.
You will implement data quality checks
column3: and data cleaning processes to ensure the accuracy and high quality of ingested and processed data.

column1: You will participate in a 12/7 on-call rotation and act as the initial responder for any issues with the data pipelines.
You will lead root cause analysis (RCA) and incident management efforts.
You will support and uphold company policies
What You'll Bring
At least 4+ years of experience development of big data technologies/data pipelines
Experience with big data technologies like Hadoop
column4: or similar frameworks on the cloud (GCP preferred
column6: Azure etc.) to build batch data pipelines with strong focus on optimization

column1: Experience in programming languages like Java or Python
Experience in managing Spark Streaming
Experience in writing SQL to analyze
column3: profile data preferably in BigQuery or SPARK SQL

column1: Strong troubleshooting skills to analyze Spark Event logs and provide recommendations on Spark container optimization
Ability to move at a rapid pace with quality and start delivering with minimal ramp up time will be crucial to succeed in this initiative.
Effective communication and collaboration skills are necessary for working in a team environment and coordinating efforts between different stakeholders involved in the project.
Nice To Have From You
Good understanding of REST APIs - working knowledge on Apache Druid
column4: GraphQL or similar technologies. Understanding of API contracts

column1: Exposure in UI development using React.
Exposure in developing reports/dashboards using Looker/Tableau

We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here

column1: Overview

The Data Entry Clerk plays a crucial role in maintaining database integrity and ensuring the accurate entry and management of data across various platforms. This position is essential in supporting numerous departments by providing timely and precise data entry services. The individual will be responsible for inputting
column3: and managing data while adhering to quality assurance processes. The work environment is predominantly clerical and requires the ability to handle sensitive information with the utmost confidentiality. By ensuring that all data is entered accurately and in a timely manner
column4: the Data Entry Clerk contributes significantly to the overall efficiency and productivity of the organization. Successful candidates will display a strong ability to manage their time effectively while prioritizing tasks to meet deadlines
column5: thus facilitating smooth operations and informed decision-making throughout the organization.

column1: Key Responsibilities
Input and update data in various databases.
Verify and correct data entries to maintain accuracy.
Maintain documentation related to data entry processes.
Compile and report data as requested by management.
Ensure data confidentiality and compliance with information security policies.
Perform routine data backups to prevent loss.
Assist in the creation of user manuals and guides for data entry processes.
Respond to inquiries regarding data entry issues and provide timely resolutions.
Track data entry trends and identify areas for improvement.
Coordinate with team members to streamline data entry processes.
Participate in training programs for new data entry clerks.
Monitor and manage incoming data requests from various departments.
Utilize software tools for efficient data management.
Assist in audit preparations by organizing data as required.
Prepare spreadsheets and other documents for data analysis.
Required Qualifications
High school diploma or equivalent required.
Proven experience in data entry or related field.
Familiarity with data management software and Microsoft Office Suite.
Strong typing skills
column2: with an accuracy rate of at least 90%.

column1: Excellent organizational and time-management skills.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
Prior experience with database management is an advantage.
Strong attention to detail and commitment to completing tasks accurately.
Good verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to handle confidential information responsibly.
Proactive approach to problem-solving.
Basic knowledge of data analysis can be beneficial.
Ability to adapt to new software and technologies quickly.
Capability to handle repetitive tasks without losing focus.
Aptitude for learning new data entry techniques and processes.
Flexibility to adjust to shifting priorities and deadlines.

column1: Who we are:

InVita develops specialized medical software for regulated industries that support the advancement of Human Biologics as well as Public Health and Safety. We are the acknowledged leader in the markets we serve. Our subject matter expertise is unmatched in the industry and our products are used by public health and medical professionals across the globe. We have employees spanning across the US and two main offices (Baltimore & Los Angeles).
Overview:

The VP of Program Management and Integration Services will lead the Data Integrations team and oversee strategic project management initiatives for Donation & Transplant Management and DNA & Forensics business units. This role will play a key part in defining processes within data integrations and ensuring alignment between project management efforts and the company’s long-term objectives. column1: Position Summary

The Restorative Justice Program Assistant is a full-time position supporting SchoolTalk’s Restorative DC Program. The Program Assistant works directly with and reports to the Restorative Justice Senior Project Manager and provides logistical
column3: and operations support for the implementation of restorative programming for DC schools. The Program Assistant supports the Restorative Justice Senior Project Manager in maintaining relationships with program stakeholders
column5: and supporting the work of the RDC implementation team. This is an in-person position with opportunities to work up to 2 days a week remotely
column6: depending on programmatic needs. Some evenings and weekends might be required.

column1: Primary Responsibilities

column4: and quarterly in-person strategic planning sessions.

column3: including but not limited to regular planning meetings/check-ins (reminders

column4: and phone calls (2) attending community events
column5: and (3) attending/participating in conferences. Supports Communications/Operations Manager for RDC marketing and communication needs.

column1: Support the development of RJ Tools and Resources
Support RDC Monthly reporting
Support data collection

Ongoing
column2: self-directed professional development in diverse restorative justice practices including but not limited to individual research
column3: observation of and coaching from RDC contractors

column2: ensuring the achievement of overall launch goals.

column1: Serve a trusted advisor to the marketing team
column2: advising on growth opportunities and identifying innovative ways to use data to address business challenges and drive growth.

column2: with a comprehensive understanding of marketing measurement

column3: Applied Mathematics) or through professional experience.

column1: About The Team

Develop a balanced funding request that complies with published fiscal constraints.
Ensure expenditures of funds are in accordance with established regulations.
Develop justification statements for multi-year appropriations.
Recommend approval or disapproval of requests for funds.
Develop an obligation plan for the systematic use of funds provided.
Provide guidance to staff on a variety of financial management questions.
Coordinate various services to manage reimbursable programs.
Monitor funding execution using automated budgetary systems.
Ensure the accuracy of the formal accounting records.
Present budget estimates to the command to convey budget constraints.
Prepare justification for requests for additional funding.
Analyze a variety of complex budgeting policies to determine overall impact to the organization.
Interpret data and operational plans to understand financial needs.
Review financial reports for payroll appropriations.

BRIEF POSITION SUMMARY: The Logistics Analyst is responsible for the analysis and reporting of logistics information. This position works cross-functionally to determine ways to optimize service levels

column1: Duties And Responsibilities
Data Analysis: Analyze logistics data to identify trends and opportunities for improvement. Utilize tools such as Excel
column4: and Alteryx to manipulate and visualize data effectively. Using the analysis to provide recommendations for process improvement and cost savings initiatives within the logistics functions. Generates Reports on an ongoing and ad hoc basis.

column1: Carrier Analysis: Evaluate carrier performance through the development of scorecards that measure key performance indicators (KPIs). Analyze data related to carrier performance to perform optimal decision-making and optimize carrier selection
column3: etc. Generates reports on an ongoing and ad hoc basis.

column1: Project Management: Lead logistics-related projects from conception through implementation
column2: ensuring alignment with organizational goals and objectives
column3: while tracking project timelines and objective achievement.

column1: Financial Analysis: Where and when required
column2: perform financial analysis to assess the cost effectiveness of logistics operations and carrier contracts. Monitor and review freight bill audit and payment data for coding and financial accuracy.

column1: Process Improvements: Identify inefficiencies in current logistics and support processes and implement cross functional solutions to enhance operational performance.
Operational Execution:
Plans
column3: and executes Logistics activities and projects while ensuring assigned target dates are met.

column1: Performs daily audits and maintains manifest tables within the AS/400 system to ensure optimized routing and order fulfillment.
Creates or maintains on regular basis standard operating procedures for logistics processes.

Fosters the MSC Culture in the department and throughout the company to ensure fulfillment of MSC’s vision and unity of purpose.

Qualifications

column1: The City of Elk Grove is currently accepting applications for
REAL-TIME INFORMATION CENTER ANALYST I/II

The City of Elk Grove Police Department is seeking an innovative and collaborative problem solver to join our Real-Time Information Center! The Real-Time Information Center (RTIC) leverages multiple technology platforms to provide the most up-to-date information and intelligence to stakeholders within the Police Department and the City. In addition
column2: the RTIC functions as the Department Operations Center during critical events
column3: as well as our emergency management branch of the City. Learn more about the technology and operations of the City’s RTIC here .

column1: The Real-Time Information Center Analyst I/II must possess strong investigative and administrative research skills. A certification in Crime and Intelligence Analysis is highly desirable. Additionally
column2: the ideal candidate will continuously demonstrate expertise in analytical problem-solving
column3: encompassing the entire process from problem discovery to solution implementation. Strong interpersonal skills are crucial
column4: as this role involves working collaboratively within a dynamic team in an open floor plan environment. Although direct experience working in a real-time center is preferred
column5: candidates who do not have this experience should be prepared to exhibit a solid understanding of the operational missions and concepts of such centers
column6: and how their leadership skills and abilities have prepared them for this role.

column1: Tentative Recruitment Timeline (subject to change)
Filing Deadline: January 17
Oral Board Interviews: February 6
Final Selection Interviews: February 14
The City offers a competitive salary and generous benefit package including CalPERS retirement benefits
column2: a deferred compensation match and more. Why work for the City of Elk Grove? Proud Heritage. Bright Future.

column9: over 100 community parks and 28 miles of trails
column12: and over 270 sunny days per year.

CLASS CHARACTERISTICS
Real-Time Information Center Analyst I: This is the entry level classification in the Real-Time Information Center Analyst series. Initially under close supervision

Work is usually supervised while in progress and fits an established structure or pattern. Exceptions or changes in procedures are explained in detail as they arise.

column1: Education And Experience
Real-Time Information Center Analyst I/II: A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with major coursework in criminal justice
Real-Time Information Center Analyst I: Two (2) years of experience performing paraprofessional level administrative research and staff support experience.

Real-Time Information Center Analyst II: Two (2) years of increasingly responsible experience performing professional level administrative research and staff support in a Police department or similar setting equivalent to the City’s Real-Time Information Center Analyst I classification.
Licenses And Certifications
Real-Time Information Center Analyst I: None
Real-Time Information Center Analyst II: Possession of a Certificate of Completion in Crime and Intelligence Analysis issues by the California Department of Justice.

2% at 62 if hired after 1/1/13 and not a Classic member of CalPERS.

Position Summary
The Junior Program Analyst will primarily support the USAID's Global Health Bureau
column3: Malaria (MAL) Division as a Credence Institutional Support Contractor (ISC).

column1: Specifically
column2: the Junior Program Analyst will provide management and analysis support to the US President's Malaria Initiative (PMI)
column3: which is housed within the Bureau for Global Health/ PMI is the US Government's (USG) flagship global malaria initiative and is led by USAID and co-implemented with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Oversight of PMI is carried out under the leadership of the U.S. Global Malaria Coordinator.

column1: As described in End Malaria Faster: U.S. President's Malaria Initiative Strategy 2021-2026
column2: the goals of PMI are to reduce malaria mortality
column4: and accelerate progress toward national or subnational elimination in PMI partner countries. PMI's strategic approach includes reaching the unreached
column8: and innovating and leading. PMI supports the implementation of evidence-based interventions at-scale
column9: including malaria diagnosis with microscopy and malaria diagnostic tests
column10: malaria treatment with artemisinin-based combination therapy
column11: vector control with insecticide-treated mosquito nets and indoor residual spraying
column13: such as intermittent preventive treatment of malaria in pregnancy and seasonal malaria chemoprevention
column16: and SBC. The Initiative is results-based
column18: and exhibits a high level of financial and programmatic accountability.
